docs.snippet: Designed to protect Southern slave states, this outdated institution undermines participatory democracy no matter who wins the White House....
docs.lead_paragraph: Designed to protect Southern slave states, this outdated institution undermines participatory democracy no matter who wins the White House.
docs.abstract: Editorial calls for abolition of Electoral College, which gave Donald Trump presidency despite his loss of popular vote by over 2.8 million votes; argues system is dubious legacy of slavery era and gives disproportionate weight to smaller states; proposes adoption of National Popular Vote interstate compact, which would ensure winner of national popular vote would become president.

headline.main: Time to End the Electoral College
headline.print_headline: Time to End the Electoral College

docs.snippet: Electors across the country faced protests, reflecting a vast divide that carried over from a tumultuous race and that the new president will be facing....
docs.lead_paragraph: Electors across the country faced protests, reflecting a vast divide that carried over from a tumultuous race and that the new president will be facing.
docs.abstract: News Analysis; Pres-elect Donald Trump easily clears 270-vote threshold in Electoral College to secure presidency, but protests at state capitols where electors cast their votes suggests country's divisions remain raw as Trump prepares to take office; liberals appear to be committed to confronting Trump, even as he scorns his critics.

headline.main: Electoral College Settles Donald Trump’s Victory, but Little Else
headline.print_headline: Trump’s Win, but Little Else, Is Now Settled

byline.contributor: Jonathan Martin reported from Washington, and Michael Wines from New York.

docs.snippet: A widely shared story that claimed in headlines that Michigan had mass Democratic voter fraud and that more than half of presidential candidate Hillary Clinton's Detroit vote faces disqualification is false. State election officials say there is n...
docs.lead_paragraph: A widely shared story that claimed in headlines that Michigan had mass Democratic voter fraud and that more than half of presidential candidate Hillary Clinton's Detroit vote faces disqualification is false. State election officials say there is no proof to back up either claim.

headline.main: AP FACT CHECK: No Proof of Mass Vote Fraud in Michigan
